com.ykb.posnet.merchant.sample.xml
Class RequestMaker

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ykb.posnet.merchant.sample.xml.RequestMaker
public class RequestMaker
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides methods to prepare an xml string suitable to send to Posnet XML service. It also provides a main method which demonstrates sample usage.

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Sample usage of this class. All transaction values are burried in the code. You should actually receive these values from a web form.

prepareRequestXML

public static java.lang.String prepareRequestXML(RequestBean request)
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns xml request string to send to posnet system.

This method adds all required fields of request parameter to their corresponding places in xml string to be returned. It forces you to specify all required fields in request. To see what fields are mandatory in which transaction, see online Posnet documentation.

Throws:
IOException - When an IO error occurs.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When request parameter does not specify a mandatory field.

prepareOrderID

public static java.lang.String prepareOrderID(java.lang.String tid)
This method returns an order id suitable to use in a posnet transaction. It returns an order id like

"prg_"+tid+2_digits_of_year+month+day+hour+minute+second

prg_ prefix means that this transaction was made programmatically. This is not mandatory, but is good practice. Note that online transactions made from posnet admin pages are given orderID's with prefix "pye_"

Parameters:
tid - Tid of your company. Note that in test environment, all firms are given a static tid: 67000067. Therefore, in test environment, you should use your actual (production) tid. If you don't know your production tid, then leave this as 67000067

padString

                                         int newLength,
                                         char charToPad,

Pads given string to given new length. Helper method.

java.lang.String
